bestBHT.bht: They killed him and cast him forth, or as Matthew and Luke state it, cast forth and killed him. Others suggest that he was taken, killed, and cast out of the vineyard, delivered to the Gentiles, who were without the vineyard, and at their instigation, he was put to death, even to the death of the cross.

Archibald T. Robertson: Killed him and cast him forth (απεκτειναν αυτον, κα εξεβαλον αυτον). Matthew and Luke reverse the order, cast forth and killed.
John Gill: And they took him, and killed him, and cast him, out of the vineyard.
They delivered him to the Gentiles, who were without the vineyard, and by whom, at their instigation, he was put to death, even to the death of the cross.
The Ethiopic version reads it in the same order as in Matthew; 'they cast him out of the vineyard, and killed him'.

bhtAttempts.bht: They killed him and cast him forth, or as Matthew and Luke state it, cast forth and killed him. Others suggest that he was taken, killed, and cast out of the vineyard, delivered to the Gentiles, who were without the vineyard, and at their instigation, he was put to death, even to the death of the cross.
